content.title: Agriculture Research Stations and Laboratories Scheme
content.details: The 'Agriculture Research Stations and Laboratories Scheme' was launched by the Department of Agriculture & Farmers’ Welfare, Government of Meghalaya to conduct adaptive research trials on different crops in the Research Farms and in Farmers' Fields for adaptability and use of bio-pesticides/bio-agents.
eligibility: The applicant should be a permanent resident of Meghalaya.
The applicant should be a bonafide farmer engaged in agriculture.
content.application_process: The eligible bonafide farmer can apply/write an application on plain paper. Along with the application, attach copies of all the mandatory documents (self-attest, if required). Submit the duly filled and signed application along with the documents at the nearest office of the Agriculture Development Officer of a CD Block/ Agriculture Circle. The bonafide farmers shall be selected on a first come first serve basis.
documents_required: Documents proof of being a farmer

faqs.question: What is the objective of the scheme?
faqs.answer: The objective of the scheme is to conduct adaptive research trials on different crops in the Research Farms and in Farmer's Fields for adaptability and use of bio-pesticides/bio-agents.

faqs.question: Which department has launched this scheme?
faqs.answer: Department of Agriculture & Farmers’ Welfare, Government of Meghalaya.

faqs.question: Who is eligible to apply under this scheme?
faqs.answer: Any bonafide farmer of Meghalaya engaged in agriculture can avail of the benefits of the scheme.

faqs.question: What is the pattern of assistance?
What is the type of assistance/service?
faqs.answer: Training on Soil management, Providing Soil Health Cards, Conducting soil surveys etc.

faqs.question: How to apply for the scheme?
faqs.answer: The bonafide farmers can apply in plain paper through the nearest Agriculture Development Officer of a CD Block/ Agriculture Circle.

faqs.question: What is the beneficiaries’ selection procedure?
faqs.answer: The bonafide farmers shall be selected on a first come first served basis.
